title: Coahuila Safe Houses
name: Coahuila Safe Houses
description: This data presents safe houses in Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.basictitle: Mexican Army Captures Carlos Oliva Castillo in Saltillo, Mexico
properties.basic incident details: 10/12/2011: On Wednesday in Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico, in accordance with operation "Escorpion," troops from the Mexican Army's 6th Military Zone arrested the head of Los Zetas in Coahuila, Nuevo Leon, and Tamaulipas and one of the most important leaders of the organization Carlos Oliva Castillo aka "La Rana." Authorities found Castillo's safe houses and made the arrest without gunfire. In response, members of Los Zetas launched attacks on army troops in Saltillo as an unsuccessful rescue attempt. He was transferred to the Federal Prosecutor and two rifles, two handguns, one package of marijuana weighing about five kilograms, two vehicles (one armored), various communication equipment, and computer equipment was seized during the arrest.
properties.location: Castillo was arrested at his safe house in Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.basictitle: Military Freed 61 Hostages in Coahuila, Mexico
properties.basic incident details: 10/15/2011: On Saturday, in Piedras Negras, Coahuila, Mexico, 61 men including one Honduran immigrant were released by the Mexican army from a safe house in ejido Cenizo on carretera Ciudad Acuna in Piedras Negras, Coahuila, Mexico. The men were kidnapped from several states. The goal of the kidnappers was to force them to work in organized criminal groups. Three men were suspected of being the kidnappers and they were detained.
properties.location: The 61 kidnapped men were rescued from a safe house in ejido Cenizo on carretera Ciudad Acuna in Piedras Negras, Coahuila, Mexico.
